.> wrote:
>
> Hi,
> 
> I am using Cantera on a Linux box to replace Chemkin=
 calls within a
> Fortran code and ran into something that I cannot figure =
out.  We need
> to be able to access the sixth thermodynamic coefficient of=
 the lower
> temperature fit for a given component.  This value is altered =
in our
> code to change the reference enthalpy value for a given ingredient=
. 
> In our case (in which we are modeling solid rocket propellants) the
> =
enthalpy reference value sometimes needs to be altered to take into
> accou=
nt an enthalpy change associated with the addition of a
> particular type o=
f curative in a given amount.  We have found it is
> easier to change this =
value on the fly rather than to change the input
> values in the mechanism =
file.  I was curious if there is currently any
> way to access these values=
 from within Cantera.  If not, is there some
> way to get this built in?  W=
e need to be able to change the value of
> this coefficient, and not just g=
et its value.  Thanks.
> 
> Dan Smyth
